ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Once you turn your light off on weekdays, how long does it usually take you to fall asleep?
Notes: 1=No time at all, I fall asleep very quickly; 2=A few minutes (5-10 minutes); 3=A little while (10-30 minutes); 4=A long time (more than 30 minutes)

ElementDescription: What time do you usually wake up on weekdays?
Comments on sleep schedule during weekends or summer
What time do you usually go to bed on weekends?
How often do you usually go to bed at this time?
Once you turn your light off on weekends, how long does it usually take you to fall asleep?
Notes: 1 =No time at all, I fall asleep very quickly; 2 =A few minutes (5-10 minutes); 3 = A little while (10-30 minutes); 4 = A long time (more than 30 minutes)

ElementDescription: What time do you usually wake up on weekends?
After you have gone to sleep at night, how often do you usually wake up during the night?
Notes: 1 = Almost every night (5-7 times/week); 2 = Several times a week (1-4 times/week); 3 = Every now and then (2-3 times/month) ; 4 = I almost never wake up during the night

ElementDescription: How long does it usually take you to go back to sleep after you wake up during the night?
Notes: 1 = I usually don't wake up during the night; 2 = No time at all, I go back to sleep very quickly; 3 =A few minutes (5-10 minutes); 4 =A little while (10-30 minutes) ; 5 =A long time (more than 30 minutes);

ElementDescription: Some kids take naps in the daytime every day, others never do. Do you nap?
Notes: 1 = I never nap; 2 = I never nap unless I am sick; 3 =I sometimes nap; 4 =I nap almost every day;

ElementDescription: Most nights, do you feel you get
Notes: 1 = too much sleep?; 2 = the right amount of sleep?; 3 =too little sleep?;

ElementDescription: Most nights, do you consider yourself to be
Notes: 1 = a great sleeper?; 2 = a good sleeper?; 3 =an okay sleeper?; 4 =a poor sleeper?;

ElementDescription: How often have you had trouble falling asleep at bedtime?
How often do you wake up during the night?
How often do you feel sleepy or fall asleep when you are Eating
How often do you feel sleepy or fall asleep when you are Talking with someone else
How often do you feel sleepy or fall asleep when you are At school
How often do you feel sleepy or fall asleep when you are Playing
How often do you feel sleepy or fall asleep when you are Riding in a car or bus for a short time (less than 20 minutes)
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
